lines.content: Welcome to Duke! This is a user guide for the task tracker Duke.
1. Download the jar file for Duke under "Releases"
2. Extract it to an empty folder
Below are the list of commands that can be used with Duke
Please remember to follow the input format strictly!
1. list || (to see the current tasks saved)
2. `todo <task>` || Adds a task with no particular time to take note of
3. `event <task> /from <start time of event> /to <end time of event>` || Adds an event with a start and end time
4. `deadline <task> /by <deadline of task>` || Adds a task with a deadline
5. `mark <task number>` || To mark a task as done
6. `unmark <task number>` || To mark a task as not done
7. `delete <task number>` || To remove a task from the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
What would you like to do?
Welcome to Duke! This is a user guide for the task tracker Duke.
1. Download the jar file for Duke under "Releases"
2. Extract it to an empty folder
Below are the list of commands that can be used with Duke
Please remember to follow the input format strictly!
1. list || (to see the current tasks saved)
2. `todo <task>` || Adds a task with no particular time to take note of
3. `event <task> /from <start time of event> /to <end time of event>` || Adds an event with a start and end time
4. `deadline <task> /by <deadline of task>` || Adds a task with a deadline
5. `mark <task number>` || To mark a task as done
6. `unmark <task number>` || To mark a task as not done
7. `delete <task number>` || To remove a task from the list

Now you have 1 tasks in the list.

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
System.out.println("File not found, a new one will be created shortly!");
System.out.println("What would you like to do?");
* @param description the activity that needs be done by the user
* @param by the deadline by which the user needs to finish said activity
* Returns a string representation of the deadline-type task to be printed for the user
* Returns a string representation of the deadline-type task to be stored in the text file
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the string in a format to be presented to the user
* Returns the string in a format to be stored in the text file
* @return the formatted string to be stored in the text file
* Returns the symbol of the task
* Returns the boolean value of whether a task has been marked as done or not
* @return true if the task has been marked as done, false otherwise
* marks the task as not done
* Checks if the task has been marked as done and returns the appropriate symbol
* @return returns "[X]" if done, and  "[ ]" if not done
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X
* Returns a string representation of the task to be presented to the user
* Returns a string representation of the task to be stored in the text file
* Takes in the users command and carries out the corresponding action
* @param userInput the command that the user inputs
* Reads through the text file and initiates all the saved tasks
* @param filePath the string that represents the filepath where the text is stored
* @return The ArrayList with all the stored tasks
* @throws FileNotFoundException throws an error if the file is not found
public static ArrayList<Task> readFile(String filePath) throws FileNotFoundException {
File f = new File(filePath); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
Event event = new Event(description, userInputParts[0], userInputParts[1]);

* @param toFile the formatted string from the tasks that are to be written into the text file
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to this file
public static void writeToFile(String toFile) throws IOException {
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to this file
public static void clearFile() throws IOException {
* Updates the text file with the current list of tasks during the latest running of Duke
* @param taskList the ArrayList of tasks to be updated to the text file
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<Task>(100);
*Iterates through taskList and prints the task number, description, status and other
* details such as start and end time for the relevant task types
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:\n");
* Deletes a task from the array based on its index
* @param userInput The index of the item that is to be deleted
//to check if an item is within the index of the list
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + taskList.get(itemNumber).getSymbol()
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Accesses the index of the item in the array and updates its status to be done
* @param userInput The index of the item to be marked as done
//to check if an item is within the index of the list
System.out.println("The task has already been completed!");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + taskList.get(itemNumber).getStatusIcon() + taskList.get(itemNumber).getDescription());
* Accesses the index of the item in the array and updates its status to be not done
* @param userInput The index of the item to be marked as not done
//to check if an item is within the index of the list
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + "    "
System.out.println("The task has not been completed!");
* Creates an Event-type task and adds it to the array list
* The user input is parsed into the function and split into three parts: the description,
* the start time and the end time.
* A message at the end will inform the user what is the updated number of tasks that they have
* @param userInput The user input to be parsed and split into its parts.
Event event = new Event(userInputParts[0], userInputParts[1], userInputParts[2]);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* Creates a Deadline-type task and adds it to the array list
* The user input is parsed into the function and split into two parts: the description
* A message at the end will inform the user what is the updated number of tasks that they have
* @param userInput The user input to be parsed and split into its parts.
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* Creates an todo-type task and adds it to the array list

* A message at the end will inform the user what is the updated number of tasks that they have
* @param userInput The user input to be parsed
//checks if description is empty and throws warning back to user
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* Prints out all items in the task list that contain the keyword and their respective indexes
* If no items are found with the given keyword, a prompt will be given to the user
* @param userInput The keyword the user will use to look for the item
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

static String greeting = (line + "Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "What can I do for you?\n" + line);
static String goodBye = (line + "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n" + line);
System.out.println("Here are the list of commands:");
System.out.println("1. list (to see the current tasks saved)");
System.out.println("2. todo <task> (for tasks with no particular time to take note of)");
System.out.println("3. event <task> /from <start of event> /to <end time of event>");
System.out.println("5. mark <task number> (to mark a task as done)");
System.out.println("6. unmark <task number> (to mark a task as not done)");
System.out.println("7. delete <task number> (to remove a task from the list)");

System.out.println("Please ensure the number you have entered is within the list!");
